title: PyMatch Core
text: pyMatch is a database of users and their interests. Given a user from its database, it will search and return others with matching/mutual interests

title: PyMatch Core
text:
Users

Add



add_someone

 add_someone (name:Optional[str], username:str, user_id:str,
              interests:List[str], database_name:str)

Add a new user




Type
Details




name
typing.Optional[str]



username
str



user_id
str
unique identifier to authenticate users


interests
typing.List[str]



database_name
str
create or connect to an existing database





Find



find_by_userid

 find_by_userid (user_id:str)

Find a user from thier user_id


Delete



delete_user

 delete_user (user_id:str)

Deletes an entry using thier user_id if they exist

title: PyMatch Core
text:
Match


match_interests

 match_interests (user_id:str, database_name:str)

Match users to a given user_id and return names and common/shared interests

title: PyMatch Core
text:
Stats

Get whole database



database_exists

 database_exists (database_name:str)

check if db exists by checking if there’s at least one item



fetch_all

 fetch_all (database_name:str)

fetches the whole database
this is from deta’s docs: https://docs.deta.sh/docs/base/sdk/#fetch-all-items-1
uses database_exists



database_to_dataframe

 database_to_dataframe (database_name:str)

fetches the whole database and converts it to a pandas dataframe
uses fetch_all


Count interests



count_interests

 count_interests (database_name:str='users')

Shows each interest and how many times they occur. If needed, this can work for any column that contains a list of strings.
Uses database_to_dataframe



interestcount_to_dataframe

 interestcount_to_dataframe (database_name:str='users')

Get interest counts as a pandas dataframe
Uses database_to_dataframe


User stats



total_users

 total_users (database_name:str)

Count total users. Uses fetch_all
